For configuration management, for instance, constituent systems manage their own configurations while the SoS addresses configuration management as it applies to the mix of systems in the SoS. Risk is managed by the constituent systems based on assessment of risk as it applies to their outcomes, while the SoS risk management looks at risk to the SoS.
